Reviews.Title: “Time for a reno”
Reviews.Author: FlyingOwl
Reviews.Content: Whilst one can only nod in agreement with the kudos PdlR gets for its location and charm, the plain fact of the matter is management needs to reinvest some cash into this property. The upholstery on the chairs just inside the front door is alarmingly worn, the walls throughout are scuffed and chipped, and the handle of our door came off in the porter's hand. Bathroom and lighting fixtures were also in need of repair. For 800 USD/night, travelers surely have other much fresher options in town.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: marco56italy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful building, great decor, the most beautiful square of Paris, friendly and classy service.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: kingkelly77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off the square and hidden away in a courtyard. It's quiet and secluded but feels like home. Big woodern beams and stone pillars with large open fireplaces and an honesty bar. You immediately relax and feel at home. The staff cant do enough for you and service was excellent. I was given an upgrade from my standard room which was very kind of them. I had a two floor suite, room 15, beautiful bathroom with Molton brown, a lounge with large flat screen and long draping curtains. Upstairs a large double bed, plenty of wardrobe space and another flat screen. The best hotel I've stayed in so far in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in an amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: berkeleyCA
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Pavillion de la Reine and this time we brought all three children (ages 2, 4 and 7). They are so accomidating with the set up of the rooms and each seems to have a different personality. We especially love this hotel because of the Place des Vosges right across the street. The kids love to play in the park and run around. All the restaurants in the area are perfect for little children and every day we just walked around and explored. The hotel is super quiet and the service is outstanding. It also smells amazing! I asked the concierge what it was, they he told me I could buy the room sent from them. I did and I use it in my house now! Love the place and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeK832655
Reviews.Content: I liked everything about this hotel, from service to simple decor, but nothing beats the location: Place des Vosges, easily my favorite "place" in Paris. Yes, the Place de la Concorde always takes my breath away, but this area is my favorite to explore. For the real Paris, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Paris Perfection”
Reviews.Author: gingergirl007
Reviews.Content: Pavillon de la Reine has a perfect location on the sublime Place des Vosges on the calm, non-touristy Right Bank in a gorgeous old building. The service is excellent, one of the best in the world. There is a lovely, cozy fireplace and and honor bar tucked to the side of the lobby. I've stayed here several times, and it is one of my favorite hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: rialto11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the location on the beautiful square, the proximity to L'Ambroisie ( a high end restaurant) , and the very quiet rooms. The service was excellent by any global standard, getting a taxi was a breeze, and the staff was very accommodating- especially the breakfast team. We liked the fireplace and honor bar. There are plenty of dining options nearby, though you have to do your homework. The Carnavalet Museum is very convenient and is not very crowded. Be aware that the rooms on the top floor, especially the ones with two levels can be a bit awkward, but our 3 teenagers did not complain at all. Overall, a very good experience, and a place we will definitely return to.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil retreat”
Reviews.Author: Condor1950
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a delight. I've styled quite a few times in this idel location. Very comfortable, calm, excellent staff & a tasty breakfast. The hammam & jacuzzi are a welcome treat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: George610
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, stylish but low-key decor. Cavernous, old building [former hotel particulier, like many hotels in Le Marais], thoroughly modernized. Cannot say enough good things about it. The room we stayed in [back courtyard facing] was a bit tight, which is standard for Paris, and so it is not a major issue. I imagine front garden facing rooms are out of this world. The guest-only honesty bar is a lovely feature. Did not try the fabulous spa, but I am sure it's amazing. Just make sure you turn the heat off [the radiator by the window] - remember, we stayed in November, - or else it gets too hot at night!

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap, but totally lovely.”
Reviews.Author: lkbeep
Reviews.Content: They do a really nice job. The place is well run, staff is very good, rooms are very nice, well-maintained, great plumbing, etc. And a great location. Rooms aren't huge -- which I think is the way it is in Paris, but the place is really really nice.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GreenMonster19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary in Paris. We could not have picked a more perfect city or a more perfect hotel for the celebration. Not only is Pavillon de la Reine beautiful, but also everyone associated with it is delightful. The Place des Vosges is incredibly charming and as you enter the courtyard of the hotel, you feel as if you have been transported to another time. The hotel is meticulously maintained and the service is extraordinary. No request went unfulfilled. We were particularly appreciative of Arnauld, the concierge, who assisted us with restaurant reservations and information about concerts and other places we wanted to go. We loved being able to start our day with a delicious breakfast in the hotel library and finish our day with a cocktail by the fire in the parlor or with a dip in the hot tub. Our return to Paris will certainly include a return to Pavillon de la Reine. This is a very special hotel that we would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: TravelDaddy65
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is extraordinary -- the location, the decor, the service. It's my first choice in a city of great hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to say in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: MDRSW
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful experience and stay. The staff was very friendly and responsive, the concierge successfully made all of our restaurant reservations beforehand and our room (which was recently renovated) was very nice. The location is outstanding and you can easily walk to other areas (or short walk to Metro). It is a very secluded and quiet location, with a courtyard behind the Place de Vosges. A truly great setting in a great part of the city. Our trip was to celebrate a wedding anniversary and it exceeded all of our expectations. We would stay here in a minute next time we come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect oasis”
Reviews.Author: ralphine1
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many hotels in Paris, I can say that this hotel is exceptional. I will never stay anywhere else again. Stepping from the Place des Vosges you enter a beautiful courtyard leading to the hotel which is a true oasis of calm and dignified beauty. I had a very spacious room (for Paris) with an exceptional bathroom. Quiet and peaceful throughout the hotel it is so relaxing. The staff were exceptional. Professional but friendly and really helpful. They advised me on some wonderful places to eat close by. The honesty bar was a lovely place to unwind and the prices were very reasonable. I could not fault this hotel on any level. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel... ensure you get a satisfactory room.”
Reviews.Author: never2tired2travel
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel at the recommendation of a Parisian acquaintance who suggested the Pavillon de la Reine in the Marais would be a more authentic experience than staying at the more prestigious George V or The Carillion. Perfectly situated near wonderful shops, galleries and restaurants, we enjoyed the music offerings from buskers in the nearby laneway (especially the harpist!) and our daily coffee and macaron at Le Carette a few doors down. Whilst some reviewers have complained about the cost of breakfast in the lobby lounge we found it worthwhile and a pleasant way to start the day. We had reserved a junior suite but were disappointed with the first room shown due to a distinctly unpleasant odour in the bathroom. It was obvious that the problem was already known as the bathroom had two extra air fresheners in place. We were immediately shown two other suites, both immeasureably better than the first. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and but would suggest the rooms that are not up to standard should not be used until the odour problems are rectified.

Reviews.Title: “best location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfp718
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property perfectly situated in a historic and gorgeous section of le Marais, tucked away from noisy cafes. Our room was on the small side and faced the interior courtyard, and our bed was actually two twin beds pushed together. I found the spa a bit disappointing; the hot tub was lukewarm and the sauna out of order when I visited. But the bathroom was incredible, the lobby gorgeous, and the service impeccable. If it's in your budget, this is a wonderful choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it”
Reviews.Author: Marcia60845
Reviews.Content: Pavillon de la reine has a great location on the Place des Vosges, a beautiful park in the Marais district. The staff was very warm and friendly and we felt right at home. Breakfast is wonderful, eggs,meat, fruits, cheese and cereal. We enjoyed sitting in the Place des Vosges in the evening watching the crowds, lover, elderly and children playing and talking. This was the only hotel we stayed in where they had thick towels and washcloths. Also only place where wifi worked in our room. Also this place is very French and not like a cookie cutter hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Style”
Reviews.Author: AmbroseM
Reviews.Content: The room was not huge, the view not fantastic, but somehow it didn't matter, as everything else was as it should have been. The location, the laid back ambience, the honesty bar. This is an hotel that oozes class. Bravo....and keep it to yourself

Reviews.Title: “There is outside /and inside”
Reviews.Author: faktoader
Reviews.Content: This hotel, that I first used in 1989, is located wonderfully in the Place Des Vogues near Bastille. It's a picture postcard Parisian square. The fascia of hotel, covered with aged vines laying back from the street is sublime. People are coming into the courtyard to take photos and just glare. The foyer is imposing and welcomes you. Now inside. The room we had - â‚¬400 a night (on offer) was a duplex, very dark with two small windows. The top floor (bedroom - a bit tight for a king) had a bathroom and no toilet and the downstairs a toilet only and no washbasin. We ordered breakfast room service four times (in both French and English - simple: a thermos of coffee and hot milk with two cups) and everytime it came wrong. It was a humid and balmy August day yesterday and we were not the only ones complaining about the air conditioning being inadequate. Mainly Americans, but they were right. Staff were nice but the concierges were a bit under-knowledgeable on Parisian hot spots and restaurants. There was renovation taking place in the room next door (in August?) - we asked them to stop the banging but they didn't for another 10 minutes. 5 minutes up the road is Dorr - one of the finest fruits der mer restaurants and the first we had been into with the menu on ipad. The hotel is like a beguiling, beautiful woman whose character may not match that quite once you know her.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: HPDubai
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel. Upgraded to a duplex room ! The breakfast setting and atmosphere is the most relaxing we ever experienced. A pity breakfast is not included in the room rate. It is pricey: even the well heeled guests sneak out for a quick bite around the corner. We enjoyed the breakfast experience for 2 days as we thought is was incl. Oops ! Bit even then: no regrets.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gabandy
Reviews.Content: We had the most fantastic trip when we stayed at Pavillion de la Reine in Paris in May. We have stayed in many hotels including many five stars plus and this is our absolute favourite. We will be back again without doubt. The staff were so friendly and obliging, we had all we asked for at our fingertips quickly and with a smile. The courtyard is just magical and each afternooon there was a different sound floating over the wall- one day blues, one day opera singing, one day virtuoso violin. The Marais is right outside the front door and just teeming with life- the Enfants des Rouges markets were an easy stroll away and the restaurants and clubs are all there a romantic walk away through those glorious historic streets. The location was so central. It was so easy and beautiful walking Paris from right on Place des Vosges. The metro stations are close and easy to navigate. And strolling home under the regal vaulted ceilings of the Place des Vosges took our breath away every night. We really couldn't fault it and will be back again as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “A BIG Mistake.....the second time around!”
Reviews.Author: joanf59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 18 years ago...and it was in better condition back then. The hotel is in an enviable location, with a quaint courtyard and beautiful public rooms. The best part of our stay was the delicious breakfast (included in our room rate--through SLH). The service in the dining area was attentive, not intrusive. I booked the room 10 months in advance and knew traveling in June, that I didn't want to chance the possibility that we might not get an upgrade. So I booked a Junior Suite for four nights. We stayed in Room 90, an attic-like room, with gables intruding into half the room. The junior suite (though typically larger) felt crowded in....I understand now, in ways I never had before what life in an attic might be like. There were three narrow windows, the only light into the room. It was so dark that I had to ask for two floor lamps to be brought up to the room. The bed was firm, perhaps too hard for a hotel of this stature. I agree that a Westin bed or a Four Seasons bed would have been more comfortable. The couch was under part of the gable alcove, so that only half of it was usable. I tried to get another room assignment, but was told that all the rooms were taken. Tell me why, after booking 10 months in advance for 4 nights, (@550euros/night) that they couldn't book us into a better room? Its not like I squeezed into their hotel at the 11th hour. Needless to say, we were not happy. The bathroom, had a mirror angled down so that I couldn't stand up straight to see my face or blow out my hair. I'm 5'7" and on my way to find a chiropractor...because my back hurts from contorting to see myself. Our second visit to this hotel was a BIG disappointment. From my side of the bed, I had to bend down, to pass the gable and not knock into it cold in a drowsy/half-asleep moment. The air circulation was either suffocating or freezing. In fairness, the General Manager Tim Goddard apologized after I initiated contact with him. He indicated that he had been alerted (from the front desk reservations person) that we weren't happy...but interestingly did not seek me out. Instead, I had to make contact with him to request some accommodation for our discomfort. He was generous enough to discount the room each night of our stay. Even though he did all the right things....I have to say that I would not choose to stay at the Pavillon on a future stay. The hotel rooms need a face-lift, new paint and carpet; It also need more attention to detail--more lighting, better mattresses, cleaner furnishings....and not overpriced rooms that are small and ill-suited for their clients. While I prefer the charm of authentic hotels....they cannot compete with larger brand hotels with better beds and greater consistency. I am a sophisticated traveler willing to spend a fair amount of money for a luxury hotel; however I do not want to arrive at a luxury hotel and have to negotiate for a new room and a better price for the room they have assigned to me. I want to arrive at the hotel, that I've thought about with excitement for 10 months...and be swept off my feet into a luxury experience. I don't expect a BIG room for a low price.....but I don't expect to be given a small room and asked to pay a lot for it. That's when I say NO. I won't stay at your hotel, if that is the kind of room you offer me after 10 months of planning and a LONG overseas flight. Unfortunately, I think this was my last stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: ampthill007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding. It is in an amazing location, overlooking a beautiful square, and the hotel itself was magnificent. We went for a special birthday celebration and it exceeded all expectations. The hotel staff were very friendly and treated us like royalty! We would definitely go again. It is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, modern, luxury hotel in the heart of le Marais - would go back in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: aliceryan12
Reviews.Content: At the suggestion of a friend, my sister and I decided to book a room at Hotel Pavillon de la Reine on Place des Vosges for a recent stay in Paris and couldn't have been happier. From the second we arrived, the attentive, knowlegeable, "hip" staff treated us well. We are both in our mid twenties and work in New York City, so we had high expectations and this hotel met those expectations in every way. We thoroughly enjoyed the buffet breakfast (34 euro) and ate at the hotel all three mornings. The consierge was able to build upon the restaurant suggestions we received from friends, which included standout faves Rosa Bonheur and Le Verre Vole. It was conveniently located for sightseeing as well, and on Sunday we went for a long walk all the way from the Marais to the Eiffel Tower. Overall, we had a fantastic trip and I think Hotel Pavillon de la Reine was a big part of it. HIGHLY RECOMMEND>

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, lovely location...”
Reviews.Author: Jihanedh
Reviews.Content: I really like the pavillon de la reine, I think the location is perfect. It is a very calm & elegant hotel. Just thought that the rooms where a bit small but for the rest it was very clean, very good service, the breakfast was good but could be better. The hotel is very nice with the terrace outside lovely, i thought it was v. romantic. The staff was really nice and helpful with us. will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms starting to look a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Kirkberta
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here in March with my young daughter. It has been over a year since my last stay, and I'm afraid the rooms are starting to look tired. Perhaps it was just my room (a junior suite which I have stayed in at least twice before) or the fact that I had just stayed in a recently renovated (and less expensive!) room at the Hay-Adams hotel in Washington DC, but I have to say that my heart sank when I saw my room at Pavillon de la Reine. The furniture was looking bunged up, the fabrics had little stains on them, the stairway carpet had a small tear in it, and the bathrooms just looked small and old. Worst of all, there was a ventilation problem in the toilet, so smoke-filled air would fill the room several times a day. The problem was never resolved during my stay, although they did send workmen immediately to look at the problem. All of the other things about the hotel are fabulous--staff, location, public spaces. (I have written about them in an earlier TripAdvisor review.) But I am seriously considering trying somewhere else next time, something I NEVER thought I would do. I would be interested to know if other hotel guests had similar reactions or if some of the rooms are holding up better than others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel- Historic Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Francophile94027
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas Eve through the Christmas week at the Pavillon de la Reine. We had not been to Paris for a bit of time and very much wanted a more local Paris experience, which we got at this hotel. Walking up to the entry when we arrived on 23 December, we could see the fireplace in the lobby in full operation through the French doors with white lights on the bushes outside covered with a light dusting of snow. Felt like I got my money's worth right then and there. The service was excellent, the room was nice (okay for the money) and the location was just fine. We would definitely return, as we like nice hotels a bit below the very fancy in Paris. Their recommendations on restaurants (during the busy Christmas season) was excellent, and I felt like they were honest recommendations (as opposed to family or economically incented suggestions).

Reviews.Title: “A double bed should have one mattress, and the the room should be clean.”
Reviews.Author: NorbsUK
Reviews.Content: I booked a "superior room" for a birthday celebration with my wife. From the outset I knew we were going to run into problems. When we turned up there was a deafening drilling noise coming from what seemed like every wall in the hotel - this drilling only increased when we were shown to our (tiny) room. There were cobwebs hanging off the wardrobe and large (3") chips of paint off the door frames (Seriously, large COBWEBS!). I had asked for a double room and then found out there were two mattresses pushed together on our bed - how is that deemed to be ROMANTIC? I really wouldn't have minded these conditions if it wasn't my wife's birthday and the incessant drilling hadn't continued until we were driven out of the hotel by the noise for refuge in a bar. I dread to think what the people upstairs heard from our room, as we could most certainly hear EVERYTHING that was happening in their room - nothing quite like keeping UP with the Jones'! On the plus side the service at the front desk was superb, in particular Rudy the concierge was brilliant. I don't recall the names of the other staff members I interacted with - however, they were all wonderful. You may ask why I didn't ask to change room, well my wife insisted that we were NOT to move as she just wanted to see Paris - it was her treat so I acquiesced to her request. We also bumped into an A-list actress in the front courtyard - not sure if she was staying or not. I'm afraid I would never stay here again as it ruined an otherwise lovely trip to Paris. If you do come to this hotel - make sure you don't get room 41, this was ours, perhaps others are better.

Reviews.Title: “Authentically French”
Reviews.Author: SaddlebillStork
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's expensive. What isn't in Paris? I loved how intimate the hotel felt and how privileged I felt each night to return "home" to the Place des Vogues! There is no other hotel on the square, so if you have always wanted to live in this square, this is the only way to go. The staff was very nice. The concierge service varied (sometimes assuming you're a typical American tourist and sometimes getting things more perfect than you could have hoped for). The rooms were nice but not overly luxurious. The breakfast is great when it's included but overpriced if it's not. If you want to feel what it would be like to really live in Paris, not just stay at a big Parisian hotel, this is your place. I lived in Paris for years and I had never stayed in a hotel in Paris before, but after staying here, I will never stay at any other hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Oasis”
Reviews.Author: UHB121
Reviews.Content: We recently took a trip to Paris (as we do every November) and elected to stay at the Pavillon de la Reine, in the Marais, where we had never stayed but had visited the previous year. After a red-eye flight, we were so happy to pull into the Place de Vosges - the picturesque square where the hotel is located - and discover the tranquil private garden that served as the entrance to the hotel. The decor of the lobby was gorgeous - moody yet sophisticated - and since we arrived before check in, we were pleased to find that one of our two rooms - the suite - was availabe so that we could have a chance to freshen up before we went out. We were also pleased to find a complimentary plate of macarons and bottle of champagne waiting in the room, along with a lovely note. The suite was spacious, with two TV's, a large bathroom, and seperate living and bedrooms. Towels and bath products were ample. We showered, had some delicious coffee in the lobby, and headed out. When we returned, the other room was ready, and I moved in there. It was a standard room - a bit cramped and without much closet space - but still with a spacious bathroom and heavenly king bed. My one complaint about this quiet, charming hotel would be the internet. Suffice to say it was a problem, and the management of the hotel essentially blamed it on my computer, even though I tried my parents' computers and neither of them worked. When it was finally resolved, the internet was far from high-speed. Also, on our first day I asked the concierge for a quiet, non-touristy restaurant in Saint Germain, where we were headed, and he recommended the Cafe Lipp, which was exactly the opposite of my reques: it was loud and filled with tourists. Other than that, the hotel was quiet and relaxing, a real hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonerful location”
Reviews.Author: Shantam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the New Year. It is in a wonderful location within walking distance of the Seine and many attractions. The Marais is full of little streets with fabulous little one off shops and the Place du Vosges is stunning. I knew of the hotel before and had been one of those people who looked in on its beautiful facade hoping that one day I'd be able to stay there. It wasn't a disappointment; the hotel is as beautiful inside as out and has been furnished and decorated sumptuously. I would say however to book the best room you can afford, our ground room floor was small and dark; the lighting looked lovely but was useless for reading. We also found the breakfasts prohibitively expensive but there are plenty of cafes around. would definitely return and will book a junior suite next time.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: Lina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked behind a gated garden on the Place des Vosges. Pedestrians walking by look in enviously. The public rooms are elegant but cosy. There is an honor bar. Breakfast was included and was fresh and plentiful. The concierge staff was very efficient and helpful - giving restaurant suggestions, making reservations, arranging for transportation and drawing maps. Jonathan was particularly skillful. Housecleaning staff were considerate and flexible. The room included all the niceties - Frette robes, slippers, turn-down service and a chocolate on the feather pillow. There were spa facilities available and a small gym in the basement. A memorable stay and a definite place to which to return.

Reviews.Title: “One of my top 2 hotels from all of our travels in the world”
Reviews.Author: TheWorld&I
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel at the end of May through beginning of June for 4 nights. I can not say enough good things about this hotel. I find always that hotel photos don't give the entire feel of the hotel. It is absolutely a gem. The furnishings are luxurious yet understated, and the location of the hotel is terrific. It is in the Marais which is an old area of Paris where the nobles once lived, and surrounds a lovely park. The concierge Jonathan was the nicest of the concierge (although almost all were great). He just had a lovely, helpful manner without being stuffy. The breakfasts here were delicious and special, and the 2 rooms you have to dine are absolutely lovely. The hotel is set in a bit from the main square, which makes it quiet and special. I could have stayed for months. The rooms are lovely, with understated luxury and elegance. We had a duplex since we were with our son. There was a sleeper sofa downstairs, and bathroom, and the upstairs was the bedroom loft. The window, which we opened often, looked onto the beautiful, serene, courtyard, and we loved letting in the fresh breeze. We absolutely loved this hotel and are planning to return next summer. We rarely stay at the same hotel twice, but this one deserves our best review and return. There is a lovely restaurant on the corner, called La Bourgogne, and the food was delicious. Make sure you dress a little nicer, as we came in after a day of touring in jeans and sneakers and the waiter was not happy with us. The food was worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - But Make Sure You Check A/C Is Working In Your Room”
Reviews.Author: STFAMILY
Reviews.Content: First let me say that this hotel was a lovely place to stay in Paris. It has a charming truly Parisian feel. It's in a fun part of town. The staff was excellent. The concierge was extraordinary. I stayed here with my family including wife, 2 small children and grandmother in tow. We rented a suite which was one large suite with a connecting room. The furnishings and room size were good. My only gripe is that the A/C in one of the bedrooms was not working properly. It was August and hot...so this mattered. The hotel did not have alternative suite for us to stay in. They did offer alternative unconnected rooms, but with young kids, this was not suitable. A/C units can break, it happens all the time, but then they get fixed. What troubles me is that it was clear from the situation that the hotel knew the A/C was not working in advance and did not (or could not) fix it. Hotel did give us a credit, which honestly in a hotel this expensive was really not the point (and not significant enough to compensate). So, having done so many things right... its unfortunate that this flaw prevents me from rating them higher.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location great service”
Reviews.Author: BostonGringo
Reviews.Content: very special boutique hotel. The hotel is set back in a busy little square. It's really cool. Loft style rooms are so so but over look the courtyard. Lots of history. I recommend sitting down with the concierge Johnathon when you first arrive. He set us up with theater tickets, restaurant reservations and a personal walking tour in the Murais.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris. Real gem.”
Reviews.Author: OliveiraPorto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during fashion week and didn't know what to expect as the rate was really reasonable for the period... I was happly surprised with the procudt and servive. The breakfast is incredible and the concierge helped me out a lot as I travelled for work. The location is perfect if you're looking for the trendy and stylish Paris. Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ademander
Reviews.Content: Place des Vosges is one of the prettiest squares in Paris and this hotel is situated on the square although it has no rooms facing onto the square as it is set back from the road. When we arrived the building was lit up by loads of small white lights and looked stunning. It is a very stylish hotel and I agree the rooms aren't enormous and the service was standard. The breakfast was tasty and was set in what looked like a drawing room. Unfortunately we were only there for one night and didn't really soak in the full ambience as we arrived late and left early en route to Morocco.

Reviews.Title: “perfect paris location and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonLovestotravel
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite location in Paris, I love this part of the Marais. My husband booked two night for us after my mom & I stayed in a rented apartment for a week (which did not turn out to be so nice). The decor is beautiful and the hotel is truly comfortable in all ways. There are two sitting rooms in the front of the hotel which we really enjoyed. We slept amazingly well. The hotel is expensive, but there really isn't anything this nice in this location in Paris. We have stayed in larger rooms near the Opera, but the neighborhood is not the same. And we have tried a few less expensive hotels but they were terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Comfortable Rooms, Great Breakfast, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NickFatherofTwo
Reviews.Content: The first room we were shown was configured in an attic space and we asked for somewhere a little more spacious. They obliged our request in spades, giving us a very much nicer suite with a separate room where our two children could sleep. The staff were, without exception, charming and helpful. The "spa" is really a nice steam room, a hot tub, a couple of massage rooms, and some gym equipment. All very nicely done. When I arrived at Charles De Galle and realized I'd left our passports (and a bunch of cash) in the safe in the room, the staff jumped into action and had an envelope delivered to us very promptly. We were there during August holidays, so we were told our room was reduced in price, though hardly what I'd call a budget price ($450 US including b'fast). The breakfast included croissant, bread etc, eggs, bacon, cereal, fruit, yogurt, cheese, cold meats... sumptuous. Location is directly across from the Place de Voges park.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Location, Tranquility, Beauty in Paris”
Reviews.Author: travelerhnl
Reviews.Content: I just returned with my partner from a brief and wonderful stay at the Pavillon de la Reine in Paris. When we got to the hotel, we were greeted with a very warm welcome from the congenial front-desk staffers, who were more gracious hosts than service-industry functionaries. They handled our early-afternoon arrival with aplomb, suggesting that we relax in the comfortable lobby for a few minutes while housekeeping finished cleaning after the previous occupants of our room, which turned out to be an upgraded accommodation, from the entry-level "superior" category to a duplex suite. Others on this website have suggested that these rooms are strangely cramped despite the double-height configuration, and I must say that I agree. Though the room is all high style and refined taste, the actual footprint of the suite is quite small, with room enough on the first level for a tiny low-ceilinged entryway, an average-sized bathroom, and a "cozy" sitting area of two side chairs and minuscule table, a desk area, and an armoire that houses the minibar, television, and compact stereo. Narrow stairs lead to the loft sleeping quarters. What makes up for the relatively tight spaces, however, is the glorious window that soars to nearly the full height of the entire room, which looks out onto the lovely front courtyard of the establishment. Major pluses include the small but perfectly adequate fitness facility in the hotel's new spa; the impeccable service from every member of the large staff; the smartly decorated public areas; the astonishing hush of every space despite the hotel's location in a bustling part of Paris; the amazing setting on the formally pretty Place des Vosges; miraculously inviting lounge areas on the lobby level that served a bountiful white-tablecloth breakfast in the morning and clubby honor-bar drinks at night; a limited but fairly priced room-service menu available 24 hours a day, despite the fact that the hotel has no restaurant; a gorgeously comfortable bed and ample closets in the loft bedroom; air conditioning that really works; and nice little room amenities such as ample stationery, a nice selection of music CDs, good Molton Brown bath products, decent chocolate with turndown service, and extremely comfortable furniture. A few minor niggles include a stray washcloth from a previous stay (ick) that was nearly hidden on an upper shelf in the bedroom (double ick); the darkness of the bedroom, even during the day; a vaguely latrine-like odor in the spa-level steam room that, thankfully, dissipated over time; also in the spa, a lukewarm jacuzzi; artificial flowers -- yes, artificial flowers! -- that were attached to live plants in the front garden. Despite the little flaws, this has to be my favorite hotel in Paris, for it has a can't-be-beat location for those who favor the Marais/Bastille area, as well as a magical combination of boutique establishment, B&B, and palace hotel. I highly recommend Pavillon de la Reine for visitors to Paris who are seeking personalized service, comfortable and quiet accommodations in the heart of the city, and discreet and relaxed luxury.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay when in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Exuberant
Reviews.Content: The Pavillon de la Reine is by far the most charming hotel I have stayed at in Paris. Great and professional service, excellent breakfast in relaxing surroundings amongst an interesting international mix of guests. Cozy, stylish and efficient rooms. Room 12 is my favourite because it is overlooking the charming yard and with glimpse to Place des Vosges. Had a very nice facial treatment in the Spa, which was the perfect way to end a day of shopping in the nearby shopping streets. I have never experienced such kind and warm service before as in this hotel thanks to the charming GM Tim Goddard. Another plus is that the hotel is located just 1 minute walk from the famous 3 Michelin Star restaurant LÂ´Ambroisie. I can highly recommend it whether its for a romantic stay in Paris or purely business.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in a Standard Room (at over $450 a night)”
Reviews.Author: LeTerrible
Reviews.Content: First. In my previous review, I rushed and did not proof before sending so there are tons of mistakes..sorry...that is ADD :) I am in France every few weeks in Provence and such I Have traveled everywhere in France (pause) twice...so benefit from my objective reviews. Normally I live la vie Francais when I am in my base in Provence. Pavillon de la Reine looks beautiful from the inside and the outside and it certainly has many luxe touches as well as ambiance. That being said, maybe because when I've stayed at 5* luxe hotels like the George V and the Ritz, I never associate being service orienated towards your clients as also meaning you should feel lucky to be staying here. We were supposed to have a superior room as even these are known as not big but the Standards are truly small, especially based on what you pay. The room (standard) was lovely..but small and not comfortable at all. The staff seemed to have varying degrees of attitude based on the status of your room. Place des Vosges is one of the most beautiful Squares in Paris...or used to be. Now...there is so much boutique shopping and 'scenes' based in the 3/4 arr, which is around the hotel...that it is almost as claustrophobic as the 6th. Breakfast was fine...nothing extraordinary and even after seeing the other rooms...I would not come back here again to stay. I just didnt like the vibes. In contrast, Hortel Relais Christine , from the staff to the chambers, gives you an exemplary experience in regard to all the aspects I mentioned above about the 'Reine'.. That would be my first choice for a boutique hotel of this genre.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: maisieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! Great location in the heart of the Marais,beautifully decorated and run extremely well. Loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning”
Reviews.Author: LSlorne
Reviews.Content: This is our favourite place to stay in Paris. The position is unbeatable right on the places des vosges. We could walk to everything, restaurants, shops, metro etc Our room was stunning with views of the courtyard. Service was first class. Treat yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Elegant and Enchanting”
Reviews.Author: Kirkberta
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Paris. I have stayed here several times in the past three years, and I have always been enchanted. But while I think it is the perfect hotel for me, I can see why it might not meet the needs or expectations of everyone. Location: It is in the Marais district (in Place des Vosges, in fact). That means Old Paris. Narrow cobblestone streets, tiny boutiques, cafes and patisseries. Lately this area has become quite hip (and expensive!), but it is so in the decidedly French fashion and not in the glitzy pan-European fashion. If you want a glitzier, more international scene, then stick with the hotels (Georges V or Hotel Bristol) up by the Champs Elysees. Rooms: The building is a renovated 18th century mansion, and the rooms are among the most beautiful of any hotel I've ever seen. The interior decor is elegant and luxurious. (Check out their website. The rooms look exactly like that.) But everything is a bit smaller and a bit tighter than in a modern hotel. If you want giant staircases and chandeliers, wide hallways or banks of elevators, then this hotel is not for you. In fact, if you are unable to climb stairs, you may need to rethink staying here. There is one small (albeit nice) elevator and usually there is no wait. But occasionally I have needed to use the stairs. Also on at least one of the floors, some of the rooms must still be reached by a short flight of stairs. I find this charming. In fact, I adore it. But it would be a problem if I were recovering from hip surgery. Service: The staff are caring, attentive, and well-informed. That said, they work in a small hotel, so when you arrive very early in the morning jet-lagged from your overseas flight and your room is not available (because the people in it haven't checked out yet), they probably won't be able to give you another one. This is not because they are unaccommodating, but because there won't be any empty rooms available yet. If you absolutely need a room when you arrive first thing in the morning (if you are traveling with an infant, for example), you should either book a room for the previous night so it is waiting for you or take your chances at a bigger hotel that is likelier to have empty rooms. Food: The room service menu is basic and nicely done but it is nothing extraordinary. That is because there are several good restaurants (and one extraordinary one) only a few hundred feet out the door. There are also patisseries and cafes galore. The area is great for food. The hotel breakfast is basic (in the lovely French sort of way) and the breakfast rooms are elegant and charming. I like eating breakfast here. Hotels cannot be all things to all people, but this one is perfection to some of us.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: yungkara
Reviews.Content: Great location just off the Place des Vosges via an archway and courtyard. In the Marais district so excellent restaurants and shops. Easy walk to most attractions if you like to walk but Bastille and St Paul metro stations just a few minutes away. Room and bathroom smallish but perfect - just don't drop the soap in the shower! Staff fabulous as was breakfast. Loved this place and wonderful to come back to in the evenings. Concierge has good recommendations for local restaurants but we preferred the busy, bistro style packed with locals and personality. An excellent base for a stay in Paris - even more so on their US$400 a night, including breakfast, deal booked via their website.

Reviews.Title: “a dream of a hotel on place des vosges”
Reviews.Author: richard85_9
Reviews.Content: understated elegance just off the place des vosges in a restored 17th century mansion. Chic rooms, and new gym, hot tub and co-ed hammam

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, room could be better”
Reviews.Author: jobetim
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for a birthday celebration, and checked into this hotel offering an August discount, which included breakfast. This hotel is beautifully situated off the Place de Vogues in the Marais, and we had a room on the top floor. No serious complaints at all. Hotel rooms in Paris are traditionally small, but our room was reasonable in size. Our only misgivings were that the beds were rather average in quality, and the room only had a single small chair to relax in - your partner has the bed. Nice breakfast, but pricey if it's not included in the tariff (34 Euros!). Overall - recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: peedog1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 17 days travelling around Europe and this was the pick of all the hotels we stayed in. The rooms are full of character and clean. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is small, I think about 50 rooms and has a cozy feel. We loved the location of Le Marais, it is not nearly as touristy as the the area around the Champs D'Elysees. It has more the feel of a village within a city. There are heaps of little brasseries and boutique shops to visit. The major Paris attractions are not that local, perhaps a 20 min walk to the louvre and 25 to the Musee D'Orsay. For the Eiffel Tower you'd need a cab or the metro. However, the Musee Picasso and Pompidou Centre are quite close. Overall I can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel--A great find”
Reviews.Author: tgirlvancouver
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Wonderful staff, great location, fantastic breakfast. Would definately stay that this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “great choice for a small, luxury hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: george1st
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite 6/10-6/14 celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. The entire staff could not have been more accommodating. The concierge staff was extremely helpful in arranging multiple dinner reservations and a personal tour guide. The suite was great. My only complaint is that the furniture in the living room was made for individuals of 17thC stature. You would not know you were staying in a major city given the hotel's location off the beautiful Place des Vosges. We look forward to our next stay at the Pavilion de la Reine.

Reviews.Title: “A truely great small luxury hotel, world class!”
Reviews.Author: Benarm
Reviews.Content: Based on my experience of two recent stays, this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, particularly for a large city. It is extremely quiet and has a restrained and luxurious quality about it, which I found refreshing after a number of recent stays in 'design hotels'. It is extremely well located for the Marais and other parts of central Paris and I found myself wanting to get back to the hotel, even to just sit and read the paper in the downstairs sitting area. What also really set it apart was the level of service, not from one or two staff, but everyone I came into contact with and with every interaction. As examples, on my first visit, I got an unprompted call from the front desk when I was on the way to the airport to confirm that a large fax had been successful sending. On my second visit, staff went beyond the call to follow up lost luggage (by my airline) and then ensure it was properly re-directed by the airline after it turned up afer I had checked out. Small things, but it was refreshing to see people using their initiative. I was lucky that on both occasions I was able to take advantage of a summer special that was advertised on their site, however would stay there regardless after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely for a special stay”
Reviews.Author: GmanScotland
Reviews.Content: Wetayed here as part of our honeymoon last year. Hotel and staff are great. It's quite expensive but good if you're looking for a treat. It's in a stunning wee square and not far from loads to do. Will definitiely go back...once we've saved up a few bob!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Ever”
Reviews.Author: Tipster2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 nights at the Pavillon de la Reine in June, 2009. I first stayed there a year ago and since then the rooms and common areas have been completely renovated to a high quality. Breakfast is now served on the main floor on either side of the entrance and this is much more pleasant than in the previous sub-basement wine cellar setting. The biggest change in the rooms is in the baths which are bright and have separate tubs and showers. Still lacking: a good, bright reading light. The flat panel TVs provide only fair reception, but I didn't go to Paris to watch TV. I like the Marais location more and more. I had excellent dinners within a couple of blocks of the hotel at L'oulette, Gaspard de la Nuit and the Bofinger Brasserie. This hotel is a very pleasant and comfortable place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully welcoming hotel and staff ... enchanting Marais”
Reviews.Author: Caroline045
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming, quiet, well staffed by helpful English speaking staff. Our suite was lovely and overlooked a small courtyard. I met my daughter in Paris (study abroad program) and chose the hotel because of its close proximity to her apt. The hotel is tucked off the arcades of the Place desVoges. I found the Marais district a wonderful place to explore and the restaurants at night seem to be filled with Parisians. I definitely look forward to my next Paris visit and this very special, welcoming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Predicaments
Reviews.Content: I've travelled all over the world and stayed in some fantastic hotels. I have to say that whilst Pavilion De La Reine is not the most spacious of hotels it is certainly one of the best hotels I've visited and will always return. Firstly the location is absolutely fantastic. Smack bang in the places des vosges in le marais - beautiful! You're within seconds of lovely streets, fantastic restaurants and beautiful cafes not to mention the charming places des vosges itself. The hotel is quite simply beautiful. You enter in a secluded courtyard and the foyer is like walking into a gorgeous library with intimate seating, stunning chairs and sofas and flowers. The rooms aren't huge but are well designed and extremely comfortable. On the two occasions I've visited I've slept like an absolute baby, wonderful! The bathrooms are dark but cosy and I quite like this which makes a change from stark white tiles and glass. They supply Molton Brown toilettries, gowns, and other bits and pieces. Pavilion De La Reine is incredibly romantic and it's charm seems to really weave it's magic. I've felt so relaxed and happy on both visits. The staff are fantastic, helpful and smart. One of my favourite things to do is enjoy the lovely breakfast the next day (We've only ever stayed one night). The breakfast is perfect - fresh bread and pastries followed by bacon and eggs if you want as well as hot coffee or tea. I can't remember Sundays being so good. I don't agree with the review below that the rooms are too small - they are not massive but after staying in the duplex and then in a smaller room I actually preferred the smaller room which was stunning and opened out onto a little japanese garden. Pavilion De La Reine comes very close to perfection to be honest. I have absolutely loved both my times there and can't wait to return, it's a gorgeous place to stay. Sure it's not cheap but worth ever penny to be honest. The only thing they could do perhaps is provide in room dvd players and have a dvd library - the rooms are so nice that i'd love to come back after a long day out and curl up and watch a film. I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped rooms makes it not worth the stay - even for a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: seetheworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Pavillon de la Reine for 2 nights after a week-long visit to Morocco and it was very disappointing. The hotel is pretty from the outside and the staff was friendly by Parisian standards when we arrived -- but after that it was a mess. The bellman acted as if he was "doing us a favor" by taking our bags to the room - and the room was nothing like we expected. Living in NYC you understand that space is at a premium in the big cities but the rooms here are tiny and cramped and smelled like it was 1849. We actually booked a deluxe room which is a joke. The bathroom at our Riad in Morocco was more spacious than the entire room here. We asked for a different room and they were none too pleased to accomodate us. After an unpleasant exchange with the front desk we were taken to another "deluxe room" which seemed as small or even smaller than the 1st room. You must climb a tiny and narrow staircase that leads you to the bedroom "loft area" with hardly enough space to move around let alone relax. The bathroom was also small and inconvenient. I know this is a boutique small hotel and did not expect a palatial suite but this does not even remotely live up to my modest expectations. The few positive things are the breakfast choices and the serve-yourself drink bar -- which you had better use often enough to pass out before you return to the room or see your final bill for staying there. The other positive is the location which is right off a lovely park and art gallery area -- but staying on one of the park benches would have been more comfortable than this hotel. I stayed at one of the big luxury hotels last time and am sorry for downgrading on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: PFMSW3
Reviews.Content: A delight from start to finish. We stayed just one night, arriving quite late on a Sunday night and very tired. At check-in I inquired about parking our car, and within 2 seconds the bellman took my keys and parked the car for us. Check-in was a breeze - it seemed as if the staff were actually looking forward to our arrival. Our room was just what I wanted - comfortable, well-appointed and a great bathroom. The Molton Brown products were a nice touch. The room was quiet and the bed comfortable - just what you need for a good night's sleep. And the breakfast downstairs in the morning - which, by the way was included in the very reasonable room rate - was delicious. Check-out was quick and simple, and the bellman held onto my luggage while I explored the Marais. We will definitely be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Last Good Places”
Reviews.Author: DoINeedaVisa
Reviews.Content: Le Pavillon will be my default hotel in Paris from now on, I think. It's situated right on the Place des Vosges in the Marais, which makes it ideally suited for walks in some of the most charmed neighborhoods in the city. It's also close to a couple different Metro stops. Someone paid a great deal of attention to the decor, which is neither purely modern nor deeply traditional, simple without being boring, and comfortable without being cloying. The colors and fabrics are rich, and the common rooms are a pleasure to sit in. There's a fire during winter in the breakfast room, which makes it a refuge from the December Parisian weather we experienced. It was so cozy there that we were in danger of becoming homebodies rather than urban explorers. The staff was bilingual (at least) very helpful (with changing reservations &etc.) and uniformly charming (did someone mandate charm school for Parisians some time in the past 20 years?). Breakfasts were fine (if they're not included in the price of your room, though, they're far from a bargain), and the courtyard was gorgeous; I want to come back in the summer to see the ivy in bloom. It's not cheap, but good hotels in Paris never are. And I didn't use any of the business facilities or gym, so can't vouch for them. But I'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CraigJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pavillion de la Reine for 4 nights, during the 2nd week in November. Overall a great experience. Hotel is in a fantastic location on Place des Vosges in our favourite Paris neighbourhood, Le Marais. The hotel is newly renovated and extremely charming. Staff very service oriented, professional and multilingual. We stayed in 2 classes of room - 2 nights in a superior room which was small but very well designed, utilizing the available space perfectly. 2 nights in a duplex room which faced the inner courtyard. A spacious, (by Parisian standards) open concept loft with sitting area below and bed above. We actually liked the smaller superior room better as the fixtures were a bit newer and the room design was very cool. Had the breakfast incl pkg - continental breakfast served in the sitting/library/lobby area - high quality, w/ good service best describes the breakfast experience. Overall we could find little fault with this hotel and enjoyed ourselves very much. We will return to this property and will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We must be missing something...”
Reviews.Author: WhereIsMyBaby
Reviews.Content: After reading the rave reviews on Tripadvisor.com, we had high expectations for Pavillon de la Reine. Unfortunately, we found our stay just ok, not as outstanding as the others have found. The location was perfect. The hotel was beautiful both from the outside and the interior common areas. The breakfast was very good and the staff members were mostly very friendly, proficient and multilingual. We stayed at a superior room for 3 nights. The room was so small that 2 of us could not cross each other without one of us getting onto the bed to let the other pass. The furniture was old and shabby. The bedside tables were only big enough for a glass of water or a watch. The king size bed was two beds pushed together with a bump in the middle. There was no clock, alarmed or not, in the room. The electrical outlets were switched off when the lights were turned off, which made charging phones, cameras and computers impossible when the lights are off. The bathroom was big compared to the room itself. But our shower head leaked badly and the bathtub drain didn't work. The carpets in the room and in the tiny elevator need a good cleaning job. We don't know about the rest of Paris, but in London and Rome, one could get much higher level of amenity and service from a 4-star hotel at that price point.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: JBFLO
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, friendly helpful staff, stylish decor, lovely room with even better bathroom (we were in a Superior grade room). Lovely breakfast and we liked the honesty bar. Can't recommend Pavillon enough - it was one of the nicest hotels we've ever stayed in. For UK users, think Hotel Du Vin/Malmaison but slightly more upmarket (and more expensive!). Would have described it as completely perfect if we'd had a room at the front, overlooking the inner courtyard. Ours was at the back and had slightly small windows and lacked a little light as a result. So get a room at the front and I doubt you can find a better combination in Paris. The Marais is a really cool part of the city, with smart shops and of course the Picasso museum which is a Must-See. I'd love to go back....

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely hotel with standout service”
Reviews.Author: IPGHK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in May with my husband, for 6 nights total. We completely enjoyed our stay & have zero complaints. We would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for quiet luxury with personal service near the Place des Vosges. I travel to Paris frequently & the service here stands out among the best. I stayed in a Standard room (top floor, gable roof) for 3 nights, before changing to the Suite de la Reine (one of the 2 top suites) for 3 nights. The Standard was tiny but newly decorated in a chic decor (gray fabric walls, nice furnishings) & very well thought out, with a nice bathtub, separate WC, flat panel TV & hidden minibar. Those who like a lot of space & light (normally me) may find this room a bit claustrophobic, but I found it cozy; note that there is not much room for luggage though. The Suite had enormously high ceilings & 3 full-length French windows overlooking a quiet side street; again, it's not huge, but the ceilings & windows give it a big airy feeling with lots of light, & it is luxuriously decorated, with a separate lounge, 3 bathroom areas & a walk-in closet. The lobby bar is a lovely place to gather for drinks, with cozy chairs & a well stocked honesty bar. The hotel was adding a gym & spa downstairs when we were there. The front courtyard is beautiful - walls covered with ivy - & makes the hotel feel like a quiet haven, just off the Place des Vosges (a very special corner of Paris, in my opinion; it's a lovely place to sit under the trees). The location is great for wandering the Marais & is a short walk to useful metro lines. I think the internet access could be improved though - it would be useful to have a separate area with a PC & printer, instead of a laptop next to the reception desk. The service is what really stands out about this hotel. Everyone, from the bellman to the receptionists, was sincerely helpful & friendly. I even received 2 personal emails from the hotel after we left asking how we enjoyed our stay. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonMAC
Reviews.Content: Pavillion de la Reine was the perfect spot to stay for our first trip to Paris. We researched and found it on TA and based on the reviews decided to give it a try. The hotel is truly beautiful - we stayed in a room on the 3rd or 4th floor that was right next to the elevator (the only negative). Upon entering, we discovered it was a beautiful little suite decked out in cream and red toile with a lovely beadroom, sitting area and bath. The staff was so friendly and helpful, recommending restaurants, walks, etc. And the location was great - about a 10 min walk to the Seine, 20 min walk to Notre Dame. The hotel is tucked away on a little park square called place de Vosges, and is surprisingly quiet. Closest Metro stop was Bastille. We'd def recommend this spot to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel and experience”
Reviews.Author: denverSelma_Alabama
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a wonderful week. The staff was very courteous and helpful, the room and service "5 star+" We will make this our home in Paris for all future visits. The location on The Place de Vosges made it even more grand. It is with in walking distance of many attractions, and a short taxi to everything, avoiding the big city part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkbmb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week trip to France with our 2 children (8 and 10 year old boys). We spent 5 nights at the Pavillon de la Reine in the Victor Hugo suite which had a living room with a pull out for the boys. The room was spacious and nicely appointed with a stereo and even a small kitchen. The location on Place de Voges is lovely and the hotel's courtyard is beautiful. Our rate included a nice breakfast in a lovely vaulted room downstairs. The hotel's honesty bar was a welcome escape after long days touring Paris. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful in choosing among the many local dining options. We had a perfect stay and will definitely stay at Pavillon de la Reine when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Opera”
Reviews.Author: PaddyKay
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris to see an Opera at the Bastille Opera House and booked Pavillon de la Reine for the location - just a five minute walk away. The hotel is a beautiful oasis just off the lovely Place des Vosges and I defy you not to be charmed by the look of the place as soon as you step through the archway into the inner courtyard. We thought the best rooms were those overlooking the courtyard - the luxury category - and well worth the bit extra. The staff were all most welcoming and if you want to stay in the Marais you should not stay anywhere else. If you can afford to stay at Pavillon de la Reine you can probably afford posh restaurants - but our best tip on a warm evening is to step round the corner to the Place du MarchÃ© Sainte-Catherine where there are several small local cafes around this very pleasant little square.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! and no sign of building works”
Reviews.Author: sessiagh
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a wonderful weekend here - a special treat for my birthday . It was just wonderful - lovely peaceful courtyard location just off the atmospheric Place des vosges , where we enjoyed breakfast in the cloisters, and listened to musicians . Do spend some time in the lovely park - we enjoyed watching the Parisien families on Sunday morning . We had a suite in the oldest part of the hotel - no 9 - The best part of this hotel was the really helpful and friendly staff - nothing was too much trouble , and their restaurant recommendations were spot on - Bofinger , a bustly brasserie perfect for meeting up with friends, Enoteca good italian . I just didn't want to leave !! No sign of building works !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Edward-Foulkes
Reviews.Content: We booked it following the reviews on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. this is an excellent boutique hotel in the heart of a vibrant part of paris, but nicely set back one road from any noise. The staff were very nice and all spoke excellent english, the breakfast deliciuos, and the fact that it has no restaurant for dinner is actually a good thing as there are so many excellent restaurants within a few hundred metres - it makes you go out and explore. I would strongly recommend this hotel for any couple wanting a short break in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DMinNormandy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on two occassions. The first time (Sept 2007) we thought it was over-priced but realised they were re- furbishing so gave them the benefit of the doubt. Our room was old, tired and - worst of all for a hotel of this rating - the shower head was mouldy. Really not what I had expected. The most recent stay was also disappointing - we arrived jet-lagged and travel-weary and were appointed a very nice room. (My husband had warned them in advance that we would be arriving early from the U.S. and he had been reassured that everything would be in order). Although the front desk staff were professional and helpful when he had phoned to make the reservation - they neglected to tell us that the hotel was STILL undergoing major re-furbishments. When we arrived, the children's room wasn't ready so the four of us crashed on the one bed and tried to sleep through the guys with the drills and hammers on the floor above. I felt the hotel could have/should have warned us. Eventually, the children were appointed a room about as far as possible away from our room - theirs was not yet re-furbished and the bathroom was awful - mouldy - the room smelled like cigarettes even though they now have a non-smoking policy. The bedcover was really in need of a decent dry- cleaner. We were disappointed. The builders continued throughout our stay which made resting impossible (the kids were seriously jet- lagged). We were paying premium prices as we had booked directly with the hotel. To top it off - the valet (poor guy) crashed our car as he was leaving the hotel garage. I don't think we'll go back anytime soon. It was a shame as it's a great location and - could be - a first class hotel. They just need to attend to a few details.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KR2008
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel for my birthday weekend. We spent two nights in the hotel in a deluxe room (no. 19). The hotel itself is beautiful - the outside is covered in ivy. The room we had was great - arranged on two levels with the bed upstairs and living area and bathroom downstairs. Breakfast was lovely with lots to choose from. The concierge recommended a restaurant called Le Pamphlet, where I had a yummy chocolate fondant for dessert. The concierge also recommended a jazz club, which my boyfriend and I loved. Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tibbles
Reviews.Content: We have (literally) just returned from a 4-night stay at the Pavillon de la Reine and had to say what a wonderful hotel it is. We stayed there last year and fell in love with both the hotel, its location and Paris! So when we wanted to take my wife's parents to Paris this year (their first time) there was only one choice of hotel to make their stay extra special and nobody was disappointed. It is a very relaxing hotel with great staff, in particular the concierges are incredibly helpful and patient. They are undergoing some work inside the hotel - moving the reception desk, moving the breakfast room to the ground floor and adding a spa downstairs - but you really wouldn't be aware of the work going on other than a blank wall where the reception desk used to be. Apparently the work will be finished in May this year. The breakfast buffet is excellent with plenty of choice and perfect scrambled eggs. Although the hotel doesn't have a restaurant it really isn't required as there are so many wonderful places to eat nearby to the hotel (as well as 24-hour room service, although we didn't use this). I'm sure you can't go wrong but the concierges are able to recommend excellent restaurants tailored to your preferences. We particularly enjoyed Bistrot de L'Oulette (Stephane is an excellent host, knowledgeable and enthusiastic) as well as Gaspard de la Nuit (both on Rue Des Tournelles) and Le Carre des Vosges on Rue St Gilles. We stayed in a superior room and the size was more than ample and was actually bigger than we expected - especially for Paris. Place des Vosges is delightful and is in easy walking distance of Notre Dame and the Seine, Bastille, the Pompidou Centre and the Louvre. The immediate area around Place des Vosges also has beautiful shops of every description - but not the big chains of the Champs Elysees if that's what you're looking for! You really feel you're part of Paris staying in this wonderful hotel. It is on the pricey side, but you certainly get what you pay for in this instance. It is superb. Treat yourself and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Charming exclusive hotel but poor value”
Reviews.Author: Arabella1
Reviews.Content: This is an old review but I feel I should add my views to what appears here. My partner and I spent a few days at Easter here a couple of years ago. The hotel is attractively tucked away in its own courtyard off the Place des Vosges; the impression as you enter is tranquil and exclusive. The flagstone floored lobby and public areas are decorated in a comfortable, effortlessly smart country house style . Our immaculate room on the ground floor, though smartly decorated ( in rather masculine style with dark colours, which did not help) was small and dark; The lighting though it looked smart, was totally inadequate and I felt like a mole in a hole. No alternative rooms were available as the hotel was full. The bathroom was small with a ridiculously small basin and nowhere to put. my sponge bag or make up. Everything had obviously been chosen very carefully in an updated version of 'old money' taste and it was indeed very smart but this pales into insignificance when the basics are not met. Breakfast for one was delivered to the room. I daresay it is rarely let to two people as !t just about accommodated one person. To the management's credit, after we made our views clear, they promised to look after us especially well and to upgrade our room choice on our next visit. However, despite their kind offer, we have yet to return and have subsequently stayed elsewhere in Paris - in another luxury property where we had a huge suite, a wonderful time and terrific value. That, I believe, says it all!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jlmoura
Reviews.Content: I go to Paris at least 5 times per year and never stayed in the Pavillion de la Reine before. Place de Vosges is one of my favourite places in Paris and I always walked by the hotel with a feeling that I should try once. I finally did last January and what a surprise, simply amazing. The service is impecable and the staff is very polite. When you walk into the hotel you feel the going back in time. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “tranquillity in the heart of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: javsigx101
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for my first stay in Paris. It is conveniently located on the very beautiful Place de Vosges. It is a small property with approximately 40 or so rooms. The decor is modern, with dark woods and colors throughout. I had a spacious duplex on the second floor, spotless clean with a great view of the courtyard at the entrance of the hotel. There is no restaurant but room service is available and breakfast is available each morning. The multi lingual staff here is superb, I heard English, German, Spanish and Portuguese spoken to various guests. Each agent is genuinely friendly and eager to make your stay not only in the hotel but in Paris as pleasant and enjoyable as possible. The Concierges are excellent and their knowledge of the city is most helpful when choosing where to eat and where to go. The hotel also has a lovely room just beyond the entrance with a fireplace and an honor bar. Its decor is more traditional and it was the perfect place for me and my friends to meet up each evening before we headed out. This is a very well run hotel and I very much look forward to returning very soon.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pelun
Reviews.Content: Pavillion de la Reine 24-27 Jan 2008, duplex room #16. This is the 5th time I stay at this hotel and it is still very charming. It is a relaxed atmosphere, almost the feeling of living in someoneâ€™s home. Place des Vosges is one of the most beautiful places in Paris and the location in the Marais could not be better. You enter from the street into a small but picturesque garden. Then you walk into the lobby and you immediately feel the warmth of the hotel with its colours and details. No, it is not a design hotel, itâ€™s an old mansion and the furniture follows the style; light and very stylish. The rooms are small but elegant and cosy. They got stereo and flat screen TV. Bathroom is not large but perfectly fine. I think the rooms are starting to be a little run down, so some renovation would be appropriate soon. However, it is so quiet you hardly believe you are in the centre of Paris. There is no restaurant, only a breakfast room. But they have 24 hours room service and a nice menu to select from. And very tasty I can add. The service is top notch and very friendly. And quick! Next to the lobby there is living room with a bar from which you serve yourself something cold to drink. You only have to make a note on a piece of paper what you have drunk and it will, of course, be charge to your bill. Yes, everything has its backside, and honestly, even if this must be one of my favourite hotels in Paris, it is VERY expensive and nothing in the hotel is for free. They donâ€™t have free wireless internet, they donâ€™t put a bottle of free water by your bedside, breakfast is not included in the price (and isnâ€™t cheap), and obviously no spa or gym. In fact, compared to other hotels they do not offer many facilities â€“ what you get is the beauty, charm and intimacy of the Queen of Paris. It's a Small Luxury Hotel and I like it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hospitality in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: lointer
Reviews.Content: This gorgeous hotel leaves no detail behind. The service is impeccable, the staff is thoughtful, and the ambience is beyond compare. We stayed over Christmas, and we couldn't have been happier. The roaring fire, the great honor bar, the wonderful breakfast - it all surpassed our expectations. Jonathan and Rudy, the concierges, were outstanding. Nothing was ever a problem for them! They even mail you postcards, free of charge! On Christmas Eve, we returned from dinner to find a beautiful Baccarat gift box in our room, compliments of the staff. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexSmith75
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located, on a beautiful square in a pretty hip area of Paris. We only discovered the local shopping by accident on the last day but it was excellent. The room was upgraded from superior to duplex, the staff and the service was always excellent. Only the breakfast room left something to be desired, and that could be avoided by having it brought to your room!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Lee1861
Reviews.Content: First the bad news - the rooms are good but not great. My new wife was some what underwhelmed when we walked into the room for the first time. It was her first time in Europe and when people say things are smaller there they mean it. The good news - stunning courtyard entrance off the Place des Voges. Excellent location - looks a little of the beaten path put the metro is only a block and half away and the SERVICE was OUT OF THIS WORLD. You ask and some how, some way they get it done. The service is what you are paying for at this hotel - if you want a moster room with a view of the Effiel Tower this is not your place but if you want a nice quite hotel with outstanding attention to detail this is for you. This was the first stop on our honeymoon and we were in no way disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in fabulous location. Got a mini-suite on 2 levels and a great view over the enchanting courtyard. The staff were wonderful and the honesty bar was a novel surprise! The only downside is that, along with most Parisian hotels, is the cost of the rooms is very high, Â£200+ per night for a basic room.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Leisureboy
Reviews.Content: Agree with many other reviews that this quiant hotel has an excellent location in the fashionably, stylish Marais (4e) district. Situated in a quiet park square, surrounded by historic apartments for wealthy aristrocrats, inaugurated in the early 1600's. Walking district to fabulous cafes, upscale boutiques and Notre Dame. The hotel is pricey at $500-600/ night. We chose the least expensive room which was a garden/court yard view on the first floor and included a hot breakfast buffet. This was perfectly adequate with a beautifully appointed bathroom. Hotel staff were pleasant and accomodating. This hotel is a good choice where you can romance the more local Parisian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: seacath
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was wonderful. It is a great option for a family as it is one of the few hotels I could find that would accommodate my me, my husband and my two children (ages 9 and 6 years old). We booked the room with a living room downstairs (coach made into a bed which the kids found comfortable) and our bedroom and bath were up the stairs.
