Our room package for families included a great hot breakfast in the hotel the next morning and a river cruise on the Seine which was also a fun way to see the city. The hotel is in the heart of the Marias district on the Place des Voges and has lots of cafes, and small shops very close by. It was also a short walk to the metro station which made getting around the city much easier. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Although the hotel is expensive, I would highly recommend it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice in the Place des Vosges”
Reviews.Author: Member in Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Pavillon de la Reine in late July and overall it was an enjoyable experience. We had a three room suite with a view of the courtyard that although not huge, more than filled our space needs. We had a well appointed bathroom with separate W.C. and first class toiletries that were replenished daily. I would be curious how large, or small, a regular room is. The staff was pleasant and the front desk folks went above and beyond just helpful a few times for us. The lounge, although not huge, always seemed to be a hub of activity with a drinks bar set up for guests. Since the hotel sits back off the square through a pleasant garden, it is extremely quiet for a hotel in Paris. The breakfast room is a bit grim, being in the bowels of the basement, but the staff is pleasant and the food good, although not overly-elaborate. The hotelâ€™s location in the Place des Vosges is a bit off the tourist path, but the Bastille Metro stop (a three-line hub) is only a few minutes walk and cabs are fairly easy to find in the immediate neighborhood. The surround area is lively and not touristy at all, full of restaurants and upscale shopping mostly frequented by Parisians. That we feel is always a plus. Although generally we had a pleasant experience, we most likely will stay in another arrondissement next visit to Paris since the experience of the surrounding area is as important to us as the accommodations when we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry - Only Magnificent !!”
Reviews.Author: billymax
Reviews.Content: Last month we completed our 3rd stay at this wonderful small hotel and sadly it was our last visit until next Spring. We cannot speak highly enough about this most charming of hotels and the warmth of the welcome that we received again and again. For discerning travellers this is a really excellent hotel and you will not be disappointed. We don't often return to the same hotel as if we've had a wonderful first stay , returning and comparing stays can lead to disppointment and regret .....not a hint of that here ...truly it got better and better. Our second visit initially coincided with our wedding anniversary but unfortunately we had to postpone for 3 weeks. The hotel remembered and to our surprise a complimentary bottle of champagne was delivered to the room. On our the third visit an excellent bottle of vin rouge (grand cru) was delivered , with the managers compliments. Really nice touches , quite unprompted and delivered with a smile. Rely on the concierges for restaurant recomendations and bookings. There are so many really good places to eat within a 20 min stroll of the hotel that we would never have found. Roll on next year.

Reviews.Title: “Engaged in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Anne-Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took my to Paris this Easter to propose to me, and he chose this hotel on the basis of positive reviews. We were not dissapointed! Despite the hotel being fully booked for Easter, they managed to upgrade our room, which was a nice touch. The rooms are not huge, but then this is Paris, and they can be a lot smaller! The rooms are well appointed and very clean. The staff were friendly, and the honesty bar was a great place to relax after a busy day in Paris. This hotel is reasonably expensive for what you get, but as long as you accept that before you go, then you are sure to enjoy the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Highest Praise”
Reviews.Author: gstar7
Reviews.Content: I found this gem while reviewing the top Paris hotels on Tripadvisor, and what a find!! From the first contact with the hotel staff, they were on their game. The trip was to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary, and I wanted everything to be perfect for my wife. The staff met the challenge, and our suite was wonderful, with complimentary champagne delivered on our anniversary. As we are tennis players and huge tennis fans, Rudy secured sold-out center court tickets during the French Open, no small feat. Dinner at Ledoyen was arranged, again a near-impossible table to secure on short notice, and everything was perfect. Leaving was the only uncomfortable part of the trip, and we would have gladly stayed an additional week. This is my first recommendation, ever, and no one deserves it more than the fine staff at Pavillon de la Reine, Thanks to Rudy, Jonathan, Charlene and everyone else who made our stay so memorable. We are already planning our next trip there in the fall. Tripadvisor members, Sarasota, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: travellrp
Reviews.Content: A perfect little hotel. We stayed there for 4 nights in early May. We had a small room on the ground floor (but bigger than our last room in Paris at a different hotel two years ago.) Our room opened onto a lovely courtyard. The good: quiet location in Marais near little winding streets and shops (and walking distance to L'As du Falafel); lovely common living room with honor bar (how nice to have a drink at night w/out having to call room service or pay minibar rates!); friendly staff; and a well-equipped room (good towels, a small selection of fruits, robes, slippers). A nice touch: when we brought back our gourmet picnic, we asked the desk for forks; a moment later a waiter arrived in our room w/ a silver tray and two dinner plates, wine glasses, white napkins, silverware and butter. The bad: not one thing. Some travelers might find the neighborhood a little sleepy. Oh, and it isn't cheap, though I didn't ever think I was paying too much.

Reviews.Title: “May in Paris”
Reviews.Author: neo007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after it was recommended to us. We booked a suite. When we arrived the hotel was very welcoming. Small, set back from the road, quiet and well decorated. It is near an interesting square and there are a number of small, lively restaurants nearby. I would very much recommend this hotel, as it does not feel as though you are in the middle of a city. The breakfast was very nice (bacon, eggs, toast, good choice of pastries etc) and the staff were very friendly. The only downside was the bathroom. The toilet was separate and was accessed via the lounge area of the room and the bathroom decor was fine, but a little bit eighties for my tastes, with a small bath. We ate at Chez Janou on the first night, which is a small bistro round the corner. The food was excellent, staff were welcoming and spoke good english and the service was fast and slick, with a strong french feel. It seemed to be used by the locals more than tourists. Overall, I would definately recommend the hotel and the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fairy tale setting...Just fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: STALee
Reviews.Content: I took my Girlfriend to the Pavillon de la Reine for her 30th birthday and it was fantastic. It was expensive â‚¬300 Euro's a night but all hotels in Paris are. The staff were very good, friendly and helpful. We had a Superior room facing the front courtyard, it was lovely. It was nice and quiet so we didn't hear any noise and the lovely en-suite had all Molton Brown Shampoo and Shower gel which was nice. You even had them nice hotel slippers with the the hotel name on that we brought home! You got a chocolate on you pillow every night nd one thing that I thought was really good was a safe in the built in wardrobe that you set to your own code, very handy for the passports/i pod etc. The location was spot on, lots of nice restaurants, within easy reach of all the attractions and the Place de Vosges square were the hotel is located is beautiful as well as the surrounding area. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Completely charming”
Reviews.Author: sabearo
Reviews.Content: We spent an entire week at the lovely Pavillon de la Reine. Everything about it is special, the location in the Marais, the generous breakfast and the charming staff. The only fly in the ointment: as most Trans Atlantic flights arrive in the early morning we had to sit exhausted in the lobby for hours waiting for our room. But the room is only guaranteed available after 2 p.m. so "c'est la vie". Also it is expensive but that is true for Paris We occupied a spacious suite and enjoyed wandering the neighbourhood. It is only a short walk to Ile de la Cite and Notre Dame Cathedral. The hotel is quiet, sleeping in late was easy. The hotel is set back from the beautiful Place des Vosges. The staff made every effort to please, and even proposed an Easter Egg hunt for the kids, Nice little touches!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, service should be better”
Reviews.Author: cleifur
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, right on the Place des Vosges in the cool Marais district. We got upgraded to a suite (probably due to Easter weekend), so the value was particularly good. We absolutely loved the room, the breakfast spread, and the honesty bar. The only negative: the front desk personnel could have been more helpful given the hotel's four star rating. Nothing was offered, everything had to be asked for in great detail to the point where you didn't bother. Although they were useless, they were friendly and we would likely stay there if we find ourselves in the Marais again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place”
Reviews.Author: maggs07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of those rare finds, charming, sophisticated without being fussy, wonderful friendly service, great location and real sense of Paris and its history. I have only good things to say about this establishment, the duplex room was lovely with a view over the courtyard and being able to open the windows and get a breath of fresh air and the sounds of the neighbourhood was a delight after a week travelling on business. The rooms and public areas have been renovated and are very chic without being minimalist, in fact it was comfortable and a bit cosy with very plush soft furnishings. The beds were a treat with crisp linens and the upper floor bedroom in the duplex was very romantic and had an additional sitting area and flat screen TV. Only small issue was the lack of lighting in the cupborad area of the bedroom which made it hard to see where things were in the cupborad space. The staff were always ready to help and were a real support to a weary traveller. It is on the Place des Vosges but seperated by a courtyard and substantial gates which gives you some relief from the bustle of the square. An absolute must for the discerning traveller wanting a more intimate 5 star experience of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful oasis in the Marais - charming and perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tkteri
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but wonderful things to say about our stay at Pavilion de La Reine from 14 - 10 April. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, the concierge attended to our needs with great detail - from recommending a superb restaurant, to organizing a river trip dinner on the Seine to recommending a romantic getaway for our next stop in Provence (at 4 in the morning, no less!)- every recommendation was spot on and attended to perfectly. Breakfast (which was included in the price of our room) is served in a lovely vaulted cellar, and is not your run of the mill continental breakfast. It's a full breakfast (albeit buffet), eggs, sausages toast, a great selection of breads and pastries, a wide selection of fruits, yogurt, museli...you name it. We had a Superior room which, was smallish, true, but well appointed with a very comfortable bed, fluffy robes and Molton Brown toiletries. It was cozy and immaculate and the turndown service was very professional. We slept soundly each night. One of our favorite parts about the hotel was sitting in the hotelâ€™s lovely lobby/drawing room and planning our day (or capping off our evening) with a drink at the Hotelâ€™s well-stocked Honor bar. Just pour a glass of wine and write your room number down, no worries. Very relaxing salon, equipped with a fireplace, comfy seating areas and snacks for your enjoyment. The location of the hotel canâ€™t be beat. Itâ€™s located smack dab in the middle of the Marais, adjacent to one of the most charming squares in what is arguably one of the most charming neighborhoods in all of Paris â€“ the Place Des Vosges. The 1 St. Paul Metro line is just a couple of minutes away, to whisk you directly to all of the major sites of Paris (including the Louvre and Eiffel Tower) and Notre Dame is well within walking a comfortable walking distance. There are a number of excellent restaurants near the hotel, and the boutique shopping canâ€™t be beat. All in all, we had absolutely no complaints about the Pavilion â€“ we had a wonderful and romantic time. I was surprised to read the comments from the previous reviewer (Indianapolis 10 April) â€“ It seems that most of the their problems were caused by his or her own fault â€“ by forgetting to bring the hotel confirmation, thereby not knowing how to find the hotel or knowing what rate they booked. This isnâ€™t the hotelâ€™s fault and seems unfair to judge the hotel by this. I can understand frustration with a hotel being hard to find, but the fact that the hotel is â€œtucked awayâ€� is what lends to itâ€™s charm. Also, Iâ€™m unable to tell whether or not the previous reviewer had a general problem with the French â€œcoldnessâ€� in Paris, or at the Pavillonâ€¦but I would like to state for the record that every single one of the staff members at the hotel were gracious, accommodating, helpful, friendly and bent-over-backwards to accommodate our needs. Truly a wonderful stay. We travel frequently and are used to staying in top of the line hotels, and Pavillon definitely lives up to itâ€™s reputation as being a top rated Trip Advisor hotel! Weâ€™d go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: lcwms3
Reviews.Content: I completely agree with the review dated Nov 29, 2005 from London - that was our experience exactly: the upgrade, the charm, the location, the fireplace. From the moment we arrived, hours ahead of check-in time (due to international flight times) and a tad weary, we were handled kindly and gently and competently. We were sent down to a delightful breakfast (those scrambed eggs! yum) while our bags were whisked away and the staff looked into what they could get ready ahead of time. A lovely room (upgrade) was ready when we finished eating, overlooking the courtyard. Room #10 -for our 10-year anniversary. Rudi and Thibault (sorry if spelling is wrong) were both wonderful helpful concierges. If they recommend a restaurant, you will like, if not, love it. If they give you directions to somewhere, you will arrive without problems. Try Gaspard de la Nuit for a wonderful dinner, it's only 2 blocks from the hotel. We tried the tasting menu (with wine) the first night and it was all that I hoped a French meal would be, without being hoity-toity or stuffy. Our waitress, Julie, was very helpful and personable. She helped us with our French, and spent a little time sharing with us her love of Paris. We enjoyed ourselves so much, we actually went back another night - the maitre d' remembered us, and we felt very welcomed there; this is a place we would eat at every week if we lived around here, and I bet we would see some of the same locals in there every week too. After a long day, it is wonderful to return to the Pavillon hotel at night, drop off your coat in your room, grab your trip journal, and head down to the lounge. Pour a glass of wine, sit by the fire, look at that day's photos on your digital camera, and update your journal. It is a very relaxing, comfortable atmosphere, and a nice way to unwind. Makes this hotel a great home away from home!
